summary: This is an FBI interview summary (FD-302) of Jessica Nicodemo conducted on August 15, 2019. Nicodemo, through her attorney, provides information about Glenn Straub's relationships and business dealings, particularly regarding the Palm House property, and relays second-hand information from Tara Lordi about a wealthy man from Palm Beach associated with underage girls, whom Nicodemo now suspects was Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jessica Nicodemo
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about her knowledge of Glenn Straub's relationships and business activities. She relayed information she received from Tara Lordi.

persons.name: Elizabeth Parker
persons.context: Present as Jessica Nicodemo's attorney during the FBI telephone interview.

persons.name: Tara Lordi
persons.context: Former romantic partner and later employee of Glenn Straub. She is the source of much of the information Nicodemo provides to the FBI, including concerns about business dealings and Straub's association with a wealthy man from Palm Beach.

persons.name: Glenn Straub
persons.context: A central figure in the interview. Described as having romantic and business relationships with Tara Lordi and Jessica Nicodemo. Owned the Palm House property and is discussed in relation to Bob Matthews and a wealthy man from Palm Beach.

persons.name: John Deutsch
persons.context: Tara Lordi's husband, who was sick and later passed away. His illness and death affected Lordi's relationship with Glenn Straub.

persons.name: Bob Matthews
persons.context: Purchased the Palm House from Glenn Straub. Allegedly involved with Joe Walsh in concealing a mortgage from EB5 investors. Straub kept personal items belonging to Matthews.

persons.name: Mia Matthews
persons.context: Mentioned as the reason Glenn Straub sold the Palm House to Bob Matthews due to Straub's 'infatuation' with her.

persons.name: Craig Galle
persons.context: Allegedly deeply involved in questionable activity regarding the Palm House, including possibly diverting Straub's money and forming LLCs used to divert EB5 investor funds.

persons.name: Les Evans
persons.context: Allegedly, along with Craig Galle, intentionally did not file a mortgage held by Straub on the Palm House for six months.

persons.name: Joe Walsh
persons.context: Allegedly worked with Bob Matthews to conceal a mortgage from EB5 investors related to the Palm House.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Not directly named by Tara Lordi, but Nicodemo speculates he is the 'wealthy guy' from Palm Beach that Lordi said was on Straub's yacht and had been in trouble for being with underage girls.

connections.description: Began as a romantic relationship while Lordi was married. Later, Lordi worked for Straub and learned about his businesses.
Nicodemo indicates Straub treated and threatened her in a manner similar to how he treated Lordi, suggesting a personal history.
Lordi conveyed detailed information about Straub's business and personal life to Nicodemo during a 2018 phone call.
Straub sold the Palm House to Matthews. Straub also kept personal items of Matthews and talked about him being a 'bad boy.'
Galle was deeply involved in Straub's Palm House business dealings. Lordi advised Straub of concerns about Galle, but no falling out occurred.
Allegedly acted together to intentionally delay filing a mortgage on the Palm House to conceal it from investors.
Allegedly worked together to conceal a mortgage from EB5 investors related to the Palm House property.
Based on Lordi's second-hand account to Nicodemo, Straub had a 'wealthy guy' from Palm Beach (suspected to be Epstein) on his yacht on multiple occasions.

events.title: FBI Interview of Jessica Nicodemo
events.description: FBI agents conduct a telephone interview with Jessica Nicodemo, who is represented by her attorney Elizabeth Parker. Nicodemo provides information about Glenn Straub and the Palm House.

events.title: Phone Call between Nicodemo and Lordi
events.description: Jessica Nicodemo had a telephone call with Tara Lordi, during which Lordi conveyed detailed allegations about Craig Galle, Les Evans, Bob Matthews, and Joe Walsh's actions regarding the Palm House mortgage and EB5 funds. Nicodemo took typed notes.

events.title: Lordi's Revelations about Straub's Yacht Guest
events.description: Approximately two or three years prior to the 2019 interview, Tara Lordi told Jessica Nicodemo that Glenn Straub had a wealthy man from Palm Beach on his yacht on multiple occasions. Lordi stated this man had been in trouble for being with young, underage girls.

locations: New Haven, Connecticut, United States (Location of phone interview)
Palm Beach (Mentioned as home of the 'wealthy guy' suspected to be Jeffrey Epstein)
Nantucket (Mentioned in relation to Bob Matthews, but details were not recalled by Nicodemo)
Palm House (A property development project previously owned by Glenn Straub and sold to Bob Matthews)
keyFacts: Tara Lordi told Jessica Nicodemo that Glenn Straub had a 'wealthy guy' from Palm Beach on his yacht who had been in trouble multiple times for being with young, underage girls. Nicodemo now suspects this man was Jeffrey Epstein.

Allegations were made that Craig Galle and Les Evans intentionally delayed filing a mortgage held by Glenn Straub on the Palm House for six months to help Bob Matthews and Joe Walsh conceal it from EB5 investors.
Further allegations state Craig Galle formed LLCs that were used by Bob Matthews to divert EB5 investor funds.
The sale of the Palm House from Glenn Straub to Bob Matthews was motivated, according to Lordi, by Straub's infatuation with Mia Matthews.
The document is an FBI 302 form, indicating it is a summary of an interview and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the FBI.
